column1: Copy of Services for Cancellation (Updated) - All

column6: Steps

To turn off Auto-Renew on primevideo.com:

If you receive access to Prime Video as part of a Prime Video-only subscription:

1. Go to [Account & Settings](https://www.primevideo.com/settings/ref=atv_hp_cnt).
2. On the Your Account tab look for the Your Membership section.
3. Select End Membership and confirm.

If you receive access to Prime Video as a part of an Amazon Prime membership:

1. Go to [Account & Settings](https://www.primevideo.com/settings/ref=atv_hp_cnt).
2. On the Your Account tab, select Edit on Amazon in the Your Membership section.
3. Select End Membership and Benefits or End Trial and Benefits (as applicable) under Manage Membership, and then confirm.

Any additional subscriptions tied to your Amazon Prime or Prime Video membership will not renew once your Amazon Prime membership ends.

To turn off Auto-Renew on primevideo.com:

If you receive access to Prime Video as part of a Prime Video-only subscription:

1. Go to [Account & Settings](https://www.primevideo.com/settings/ref=atv_hp_cnt).
2. On the Your Account tab look for the Your Membership section.
3. Select End Membership and confirm.

If you receive access to Prime Video as a part of an Amazon Prime membership:

1. Go to [Account & Settings](https://www.primevideo.com/settings/ref=atv_hp_cnt).
2. On the Your Account tab, select Edit on Amazon in the Your Membership section.
3. Select End Membership and Benefits or End Trial and Benefits (as applicable) under Manage Membership, and then confirm.

Any additional subscriptions tied to your Amazon Prime or Prime Video membership will not renew once your Amazon Prime membership ends.

Any additional subscriptions tied to your Amazon Prime or Prime Video membership will not renew once your Amazon Prime membership ends.

Head to Passes & vouchers, hit Cancel Pass or Manage Pass next to the Pass you don’t want any more, then follow the onscreen steps.
OR 
To cancel now TV go to the my account button near the top right of any page on the website and select 'my passes' from the list then click the cancel pass button next to the appropriate pass. Remember each pass type needs to be cancelled separately.
After clicking cancel pass you will be taken through a series of dialogues. Follow the dialogues clicking the appropriate option each time. Once you have finished your get a notification confirming that the pass you have selected to be cancelled has been cancelled and you will no longer be charged for it.

1. Navigate to account.microsoft.com/services

6. Select Confirm cancellation.

For Xbox:
1. Go to [https://account.microsoft.com/services/](https://account.microsoft.com/services/) and sign in with the Microsoft account you used when purchasing your subscription.
2. Find your subscription and select Manage. If you see Turn on recurring billing instead of Manage, skip to the Troubleshooting section - otherwise proceed to step 3.
3. On the next page, select Cancel or Upgrade or Cancel, depending on your subscription type.
4. Follow the instructions on the page to proceed with cancellation.

For PS4:
1. From your PS4™, log in to the account on PSN that purchased the subscription.
2. Navigate to [Settings] > [Account Management] > [Account Information] > [PlayStation Subscriptions]
3. Select the EA Access subscription you want to cancel.
4. Select Turn Off Auto-Renewal.

For Xbox:
1. Go to [https://account.microsoft.com/services/](https://account.microsoft.com/services/) and sign in with the Microsoft account you used when purchasing your subscription.
2. Find your subscription and select Manage. If you see Turn on recurring billing instead of Manage, skip to the Troubleshooting section - otherwise proceed to step 3.
3. On the next page, select Cancel or Upgrade or Cancel, depending on your subscription type.
4. Follow the instructions on the page to proceed with cancellation.

For PS4:
1. From your PS4™, log in to the account on PSN that purchased the subscription.
2. Navigate to [Settings] > [Account Management] > [Account Information] > [PlayStation Subscriptions]
3. Select the EA Access subscription you want to cancel.
4. Select Turn Off Auto-Renewal.

For Mac:
1. Open the App Store app.
2. Click the sign-in button  or your name at the bottom of the sidebar.
3. Click  View Information at the top of the window. You might be asked to sign in.
4. On the page that appears, scroll until you see Subscriptions, then click Manage.
5. Click Edit next to the subscription that you want.
6. Click Cancel Subscription. If you don’t see Cancel Subscription, then the subscription is already cancelled and won't renew.

For Non-Mac Users using Itunes on a PC:
1. On your PC, open iTunes.
2. From the menu bar at the top of the iTunes window, choose Account, then choose View My Account. You might be asked to sign in with your Apple ID.
3. Click View Account.
4. Scroll to the Settings section. Next to Subscriptions, click Manage.
5. Click Edit next to the subscription that you want.
6. Click Cancel Subscription. If you don’t see Cancel Subscription, then the subscription is already cancelled and won't renew.

1. Go to [https://manage.autodesk.com/cep/?_ga=2.169578657.1279688067.1594823693-1029281389.1594823693#orders/subscriptions](https://manage.autodesk.com/cep/?_ga=2.169578657.1279688067.1594823693-1029281389.1594823693#orders/subscriptions) and log in if necessary.
2. Click the product you want to cancel to display the subscription details.
3. Click the Auto-renew button to turn it to off.
4. In the Confirm renewal setting message that appears, click Turn off. The subscription expiration date displays to indicate the date your subscription and software access will end.

3. Under Box Details select Cancel My Subscription. You will be prompted to fill out a very short survey and confirm your cancellation.

1. Go to [https://www.graze.com/](https://www.graze.com/uk) and log in if necessary.
2. Go to your "my graze" page and scroll down to "my boxes".
3. Click 'manage my box' or 'manage one-off box' depending on the order you wish to cancel:
4. Click cancel this box.
5. Make sure you click through any further options until you see confirmation of your cancellation.

1. Go to [https://www.pactcoffee.com/](https://www.pactcoffee.com/) and log in if necessary.
2. Check the left hand side on your account.
3. Click on Your Coffee Plans on the left hand side.
4. Select Amend.
5. Hit the Cancel button at the bottom of any of your active plans.

1. Go to [http://www.skype.com/go/myaccount](http://www.skype.com/go/myaccount) and log in if necessary.
2. Upon access to your Skype account profile page, select Manage for the subscription you want to cancel. If you don't see the Manage button, it might be because you have Skype Credit rather than a subscription.
3. Select Cancel subscription.
4. Select the radio button next to your reason for cancelling, and then select Cancel subscription to confirm your cancellation.

1. Go to [https://zoom.us/](https://zoom.us/) and log in if necessary.
2. Click Account Management, then click Billing.
3. On the Current Plans tab, click Cancel Subscription.
4. Confirm your request by selecting Cancel Subscription.
5. Choose why you would no longer like to renew your subscription.
6. Once complete, click Submit.

1. Go to [https://www.dropbox.com/en_GB?_hp=c](https://www.dropbox.com/en_GB?_hp=c) and log in if necessary.
2. Click your avatar (profile picture or face icon) in the upper-right corner.
3. Click Settings.
4. Click the Plan tab
5. Click Cancel plan at the bottom of the page. If you don’t see Cancel plan, you may have signed up for Dropbox on your mobile device. If you did, downgrade your plan with iTunes or Google Play.
6. Scroll down, and click I still want to downgrade.
7. Select the reason why you want to cancel. 
8. Click Continue.
9. Scroll down, and click I still want to downgrade. You should receive email confirmation.

9. Scroll down, and click I still want to downgrade. You should receive email confirmation.

1. Go to [www.google.com/settings/storage](https://www.google.com/settings/storage).
2. Sign in to the Google Account where you purchased storage.
3. Under your plan, click Cancel.
4. Review changes to storage that will take place after cancellation. Confirm by clicking Cancel plan.
5. You'll receive an email confirming the cancellation of your subscription. At the start of the next month of your plan, you'll be downgraded to the free storage levels for Google Drive, Google Photos and Gmail.

1. Go to [www.google.com/settings/storage](https://www.google.com/settings/storage).
2. Sign in to the Google Account where you purchased storage.
3. Under your plan, click Cancel.
4. Review changes to storage that will take place after cancellation. Confirm by clicking Cancel plan.
5. You'll receive an email confirming the cancellation of your subscription. At the start of the next month of your plan, you'll be downgraded to the free storage levels for Google Drive, Google Photos and Gmail.

1. Go to [www.google.com/settings/storage](https://www.google.com/settings/storage).
2. Sign in to the Google Account where you purchased storage.
3. Under your plan, click Cancel.
4. Review changes to storage that will take place after cancellation. Confirm by clicking Cancel plan.
5. You'll receive an email confirming the cancellation of your subscription. At the start of the next month of your plan, you'll be downgraded to the free storage levels for Google Drive, Google Photos and Gmail.

Using the new payments system:
1. Go to your account settings and log in if necessary: [https://www.evernote.com/Settings.action](https://www.evernote.com/Settings.action)
2. Select Billing from the left navigation menu.
3. At the bottom of the Billing page, select Cancel your Evernote subscription.
4. Scroll to the bottom of the page and click Downgrade to Basic.
5. Select a reason for canceling the subscription.
6. Click the Cancel subscription button.

Using the older payments system:
1. Go to your account settings and log in if necessary: [https://www.evernote.com/Settings.action](https://www.evernote.com/Settings.action)
2. Select Manage subscription on the 'Account Summary' page.
3. Select Evernote Basic (a free Evernote account).

Using the new payments system:
1. Go to your account settings and log in if necessary: [https://www.evernote.com/Settings.action](https://www.evernote.com/Settings.action)
2. Select Billing from the left navigation menu.
3. At the bottom of the Billing page, select Cancel your Evernote subscription.
4. Scroll to the bottom of the page and click Downgrade to Basic.
5. Select a reason for canceling the subscription.
6. Click the Cancel subscription button.

Using the older payments system:
1. Go to your account settings and log in if necessary: [https://www.evernote.com/Settings.action](https://www.evernote.com/Settings.action)
2. Select Manage subscription on the 'Account Summary' page.
3. Select Evernote Basic (a free Evernote account).

Note: To cancel, you will need to be a team administrator.
1. Go to your own profile at [https://trello.com/your-team-name/billing](https://trello.com/your-team-name/billing) and log in if necessary.
2. Click on your team's name and the Billing tab.
3. Scroll to the bottom of the page and click the “Cancel Business Class” link to downgrade from Business Class and prevent your card from being billed in the future.

1. Sign in to your account at [https://basecamp.com/welcome-back](https://basecamp.com/welcome-back)
2. Click on Adminland in the top right hand corner of the homepage beneath your avatar.
3. Once in Adminland, scroll down until you see the Owner Actions. Click on the option in orange to cancel the account.
4. Click on Cancel my account once more. You may want to export your data first.

1. Sign in to your Hootsuite dashboard: [https://hootsuite.com/login](https://hootsuite.com/login)
2. Click your profile picture in the top-right corner of the dashboard, and then select Billing & Plan Changes.
3. Click Cancel my subscription.
4. Click the Cancel subscription button to confirm.
5. Review the features you will no longer have access to, and then click Confirm downgrade.

1. Go to [https://c34.qbo.intuit.com/qbo34/login?locale=en_GB](https://c34.qbo.intuit.com/qbo34/login?locale=en_GB) and log in if necessary.
2. Select Settings and then Account and Settings.
3. Select the Billing and subscription tab.
4. In the QuickBooks section, select Cancel subscription or Cancel online.
5. Select Continue to cancel, then select Continue to cancel again (if applicable).
6. Follow the next steps.
7. Select Submit and cancel subscription.
8. Select Got it.

Note: If you’re looking to downgrade to a lower plan, you’ll need to ensure you’ve reduced the number of active Clients and any Team Members in your account first before downgrading. If you are downgrading to Lite, you'll need to delete any connected Accountant(s) first.

1. Go to [https://www.freshbooks.com/en-gb/](https://www.freshbooks.com/en-gb/) and log in if necessary.
2. Go to the gear icon in the top left corner
3. Then click on Billing and Upgrade and view your ideal plan options (e.g., what the Client limit is)
4. Next, if you have too many Clients, go to the Client section and check the box(es) off next to the Clients you wish to delete (also check in the View Archived Clients page for any archived Clients which count towards the limit too)
5. Next, click on the Actions button
6. Then select Delete
7. If you have any team members (like Accountants) that you no longer need, go to the My Team section
8. Next, check off the boxes and click on the Actions button
9. Then select Delete
10. ​Click on the gear icon in the top left corner again
11. Click on Billing and Upgrade
12. Select Manage Plan
13. Click on the Downgrade button next to the plan you want to downgrade to. You'll be downgraded to the plan you've chosen, and you won't be charged until your next payment is due.

Note: You can downgrade to the Free plan only once over the life of your account.

1. Go to [https://mailchimp.com/](https://mailchimp.com/) and log in if necessary.
2. Click your profile name and choose Account.
3. Click Billing and choose Monthly plans or credits.
4. Click Change Plan.
5. Choose your plan and maximum contact count.
6. Click Downgrade.
7. Review your downgrade. If you are satisfied with your downgrade selection, click on the check box at the bottom of the screen to acknowledge that you understand the changes that will take place in your account.
8. Click Downgrade.

To freeze:
1. Log in to Pure Gym's membership area: [https://www.puregym.com/login/](https://www.puregym.com/login/)
2. Select ‘profile’ tab
3. Scroll down to ‘FREEZE YOUR MEMBERSHIP’ and select
4. Follow the instructions to freeze

To cancel:
Only method of cancellation is to cancel monthly direct direct debit with your bank, at least 3 - 4 working days before your next payment is due.

To freeze:
1. Log in to Pure Gym's membership area: [https://www.puregym.com/login/](https://www.puregym.com/login/)
2. Select ‘profile’ tab
3. Scroll down to ‘FREEZE YOUR MEMBERSHIP’ and select
4. Follow the instructions to freeze

To cancel:
Only method of cancellation is to cancel monthly direct direct debit with your bank, at least 3 - 4 working days before your next payment is due.

Cancelling Direct Debit:
Contact your bank to cancel your direct debit subscription.

Cancelling Credit Card Subscription:
Email payments@easygym.co.uk with your full name, date of birth, 8 digit gym pin number and the gym you are a member of. Please note that you must cancel at least 5 working days before your next payment, to ensure that no further payments will be taken.

column5: Prices vary based on location and membership type
column6:
Cancellation requests must be addressed directly to the clubs through the Anytime Fitness online portal: [https://www.anytimefitness.co.uk/cancellation-request/](https://www.anytimefitness.co.uk/cancellation-request/) as per your membership agreement.
Note: You will need to give one full calendar month notice, as most of our Membership Agreements run for 12 months and then on a rolling month by month basis after the first year ends. It is important you do not cancel your Direct Debit instruction, as this is processed automatically at the end of your membership term.

column5: Prices vary based on location and membership type
